characters: EXT. STREET/INT. ELLE'S CONVERTIBLE BOXSTER- DAY
CO NT I NU E D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "HEAD OVER HEELS" by the Go-Go's plays as we wind through flock of abstract, silky, golden strands -- PULLING BACK, discover that the strands are hair on a BLONDE GIRL's hea But not just any blonde girl, a girl in Delta Gamma, the blondest, most beautiful sorority at USC. We PULL BACK further to see that she's signing a handmade card. She holds it up ~ OVER HER SHOULDER, we see hearts and glitter surrounding and "Good Luck Tonight!" and "Ell and Warner forever!." She carries the card out of her room and we FOLLOW HER ac the hall, into the room of -- THREE BLONDE CHEERLEADERS, who stop practicing their pom- routine to sign the card. As they finish, we follow the C Girl out and into the room of -- A BLONDE GIRL IN A TANK TOP and shorts, working out on a Stairmaster as "General Hospital" plays on a tiny TV. She signs the card while continuing to exercise. We move on, the room of-- A BLONDE GIRL MAKING OUT WITH HER BOYFRIEND who stops lon enough to sign the card, as her boyfriend nibbles on her neck. She hands the card back and we head into the room o A BLONDE PARTY GIRL who pours a pink frozen margarita int glass from the blender, then passes it down to ANOTHER BL GIRL, assembly-line style. The card goes one way, being signed, as the drinks go the other. Once the card arrives back in the Card Girl's hands, we follow her out of the room and down the hall until she reaches the very last and biggest door -- She puts a kiss mark on the card, then kneels down and sl the card under the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CARD slides into the pink room, hitting the feet of UNDERDOG, a tiny chihuahua ~ who picks it up in his mouth and trots it over to a pair of perfectly pedicured feet i strappy sandals. An equally perfectly manicured hand with a "Sisters Forev charm bracelet dangling from the wrist, scoops up Underdo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2 As he rises, we RISE WITH HIM, passing toned, waxed, tann legs in pink Prada pedal pushers and a pair of perky boob encased in a spaghetti-strap top -- until we finally reve magnificent head of long blonde hair and a sweet, beautif face. This is ELLE WOODS, 21, the Goddess Queen of Delta Gamma. She talks on a pink, fuzzy phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too! Behind her, a "Go USC" banner is pinned to the pink wall. stack of "Cosmopolitan"s and "Glamour"s teeters on the dresser. The closet overflows with trendy, designer cloth in a predominance of pink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tonight. She hangs up and lets out a squeal of joy, kissing Underd head and taking the card out of his mouth. She reads it, touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Elle and Warner forever". Aww... Underdog yips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Delta Gamma/Sigma Chi barbecue in full swing. Beautiful college students drink beer and mingle, trying to figure who they're going to sleep with next. The main wall of the living room has been designated as a "Model Wall" of Delta Gamma girls -- ELLE smiles at us fr Hawaiian Tropic ad and a Miss June USC calendar photo. A cover of an Italian Vogue shows a blonde sexpot MARGOT; a cheerleader poster displays a hard-bodied non-blonde SERE in a pom-pom pose. Serena walks up, fending off an admirer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy, enough! I am not going to formal with you. Jeremy slinks off as Margot arrives, agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can someone please tell Rick that he is not the only Sigma Chi with a big penis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are so sweet! ELLE, a vision of fluffy blondeness, runs down the stairs toward Serena and Margot, holding the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I ' m not positive it's gonna happen to n i g h t -- . SERENA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helloo...he just had lunch with his grandmother. You know he got "The Rock". MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why else would she have flown in from Newport? It's not like she'd Fed Ex a six carat diamond. ELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) You think? SERENA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you're getting engaged! В·    .           . The three girls jump up and down, squealing and hugging. ELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon В·-- you have to help me pick out the perfect outfit. As they head toward the door, Elle spots AMY, a shy girl Delta Gamma Pledge sweatshirt, standing alone. ELLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Amy, what's wrong? AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really -- know anyone. ELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) That's because you spend too much time in the library. Come with me. (to Serena and Margot) I'll meet you outside. As they go, Elle leads Amy over to a group of jovial Sigm Chi brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Bra ndon , Jason, Grant --this is Amy. Why don't you tell her about the time you guys went golfing naked? Elle winks at Amy and.heads off as the guys launch into t story. BRANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was classic.     Jason hit with wood all day. GRANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we never ran out of balls -- Amy laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serena and Margot watch as Elle stands in front of a mirr trying on a Herve Leger white mini-dress. Sexy and ultra- tight.                                               ; ELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too demure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should go with red. It's the color of confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't want to look like I know what's coming. . . SERENA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand why you're completely disregarding your signature color. She holds up a tiny pink slipdress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's proposing! I can't look like I would on any date. This is the date. The night I'll always remember. I want to look special. Bridal . . . but not like I suspect anything.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STORE
dialogues.text: A SALESWOMAN looks at her cohort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sot.to)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There ' s nothing I love more than a dumb blonde with daddy's plastic. She grabs a dress off the Clearance Sale rack, ripping of the "HALF PRICE" TAG.

dialogues.speaker: ON ELLE AND THE GIRLS
dialogues.text: . SERENA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait to see you wearing The Rock! Elle looks at them, suddenly concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wh at if -- you know -- it's not the night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why else would he be taking you to The Ivy? You've been dating for a year -- it's not like he's trying to impress you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle, you've heard the man pass gas in his sleep. That practically means you're pre-engaged. The Saleswoman approaches with the dress, kiss-assy smile her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see this one? We just got it in yesterday. Elle fingers the dress, then the new price tag, looking b at the saleswoman, excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a low-viscosity rayon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yes -- of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With half-loop top-stitching on the hem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling a lie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. It's one of a kind.

dialogues.speaker: CO NT I NU E D
dialogues.text: ^       Elle hands the dress back to her, no longer prete excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's impossible to use a half-loop topstitch on low-viscosity rayon. It would snag the fabric. And you didn't just get this in, because I remember it from the June Vogue a year ago, so if you're trying to sell it to me at full price, you picked the wrong girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The saleswoman slinks off, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the saleswoman) Nice try...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle shakes her head and turns back to the girls as she s on her Manolo Blahnik sandals, doing one last mirror chec smoothing down her golden mane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dramatically) Girls, this is it. In a few hours, I'll be the future Mrs. Warner Huntington III.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, DELTA GAMMA HOUSE
dialogues.text: An attractive male finger presses the doorbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy peeks through the peephole and turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) He's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle, standing nearby with Margot and Serena and several other DG's, smooths down her dress and takes a deep breat o pening the door to find -- WARNER HUNTINGTON, III, 21, tall, chiseled and outrageous handsome. He takes her in, a smile spreading across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at him, blushing and completely smitten. kiss. After a moment,-Warner extracts himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready? Her face is awash with devotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warner and Elle are seated at a cozy table on the patio. Elle takes a sip from her freshly poured champagne flute. Nervous and excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here' s to ~ us. Warner is slower to sip his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason I wanted to come here tonight was to discuss our future. Elle is on the edge of her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ' m fully amenable to that discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, we're having a lot of fun now -- but things are gonna be different when I ' m at Harvard Law school is a completely different world. I need to be serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My family expects a lot from me. And I expect a lot from me. I .plan on running for office some day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I fully support that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the thing is, if I ' m gonna be a senator by the time I ' m thirty -- I can't keep dicking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I completely agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T hat 's why I think it's time for us to-- Elle takes a deep breath, filled with anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ( ot n ig . . В· > . ' . c n iu n )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should break up. Elle's champagne glass drops from her hand and CRASHES on the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Elle starts to flush, completely caught off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ' m sorry, Elle, I just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're breaking up with me?! (tearing up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were proposing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proposing?! Elle, If I ' m going to be a politician, I need to marry a Jackie, not a -- Marilyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're breaking up with me because I ' m too -- blonde?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T hat' s not entirely --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what? My boobs are too big?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle -- no --В· your boobs are fine -- Her tears start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when you said you'd always love me, you were just "dicking around"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warner looks around the restaurant nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do love you, Elle. I just can't marry you. You have no idea the pressure I ' m under. My family has five generations of senators. My brother is in the top three at Yale Law. He just got engaged to a Vanderbilt, for crissakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle stares at him aghast, tears streaming down her face, then pushes her chair away from the table and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's not like I have a choice, sweetheart

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle teeters down the sidewalk as best she can in her thr inch heels, sobbing. Warner pulls up alongside her in his convertible Saab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.   Let me take you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle -- it's twenty miles back to campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle stops, thinks a minute, then gets in, still crying. Catching her poofy little purse in the door. She re-opens i t, yanking the purse back in. Warner pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warner pulls up in front. It's a starry, romantic night. Everything should be perfect. It's not. Elle sits, still in shock, as tears continue to eke out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle, believe me, I never expected to be doing this, but I think it's the right thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can it be the right thing if we're not together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to think about my future. And what people expect from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're breaking up with me because you're afraid your family won't like me? (through her tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody likes me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: East coast people are different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because I ' m not a Vanderbilt, all of a sudden I ' m white trash? I grew up in Bel Air, Warner! Across the street from Aaron Spelling! I think most people would agree that's way better than a Vanderb ilt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, Elle.       I need someone -- serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ' m seriously in love with you -- Isn't that enough? He looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ' m sorry. She gets out of the car and drags herself up the stairs t her sorority house. When she's at the top, she turns back look at him. His perfect cheekbones highlighted by the streetlamp. He meets her eyes, pained, but determined.       Then pul leaving her there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle walks down the pink and green carpeted hall, dazed a tear-stained. Margot and Serena emerge from the bathroom, post-shower. Getting ready for a night out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you back so soon? Serena sees Elle's bare hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he forget the ring? Elle silently walks into her room.      Serena and Margot worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle slumps down in an inflatable chair, hugging her knee and cowering in a wretched little ball. Underdog stares a her, concerned. Serena and Margot stand in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the Rock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not engaged.     It's over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He broke up with me! Serena and Margot gasp in horror, rushing to her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a Kappa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a Theta --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- it's just -- not me. I ' m canceling the mixer.   We'll blacklist Sigma Chi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Serena, but I don't think it'll do any good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle starts to lose it again. ;       ELLE I don't know! Everything was normal at first and then he said he needed someone mo r e -- (sob-choked) Serious! .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S e r i o u s ? ! Who the hell does he think he i s ? Y o u ' r e the most popu l a r month on the U S C calendar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S h e points to Elle's "Miss June" page, hanging on the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O h , he is so over on this campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don ' t underst a n d what went wrong --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's the grandmother.        Have you e v e r me t he r ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E l l e wipes her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last month on his birthday. And she liked me! She said I looked like Britney Spears. Why would you say that to someone you didn't like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shrug, mystified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! I don't know anything any more! (wiping a tear) I just need to be by myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle nods.    The girls rise, hugging her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still love you.      Sisters forever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniffling) Thank you. I love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they go, Margot looks at Serena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God. What if Josh doesn't think I ' m serious enough?    .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helloo... you let him have anal sex with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helloo... you let him videotape you diddling yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. Phew!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the girls go, they shut the door behind them. Elle gets up and grabs a FRAMED PHOTO of Warner, then lie down on her bed, clutching it to her heart. Underdog leap up and gives her little doggy kisses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises on a sad day.     "HOPELESSLY DEVOTED" by O Newton-John plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy knocks on Elle's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER SISTER passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Didn't you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads a reluctant Amy down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spread out on the bed are PICTURES of Elle and Warner: Th Sigma Chi formal; their Homecoming Queen and King "wave";

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 a 60's party; Mardi Gras night; beach weekend at Coronado Next to the pictures are thirty dried Ecuardorian long- stemmed pink roses, remnants of their one year anniversar In the center sits Elle, wearing Warner's old oversized S Chi t-shirt, clutching a Gund teddybear. Depressed and looking like hell, she speaks to an unseen confidante.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just love him so much! I loved him the first moment I saw him. He's beautiful and smart and someone I totally respect. And I did everything I could to make him love me, but it wasn't enough. Now what am I supposed to do? I planned my whole future around him. My life was going to be all about Warner. Now what's it going to be about? She looks up -- waiting. Staring back at her is Underdog who sadly has no answers for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle remains in bed, Underdog now clutched to her chest, soaps on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Oh, darling.     I'll love you forever."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit! Serena and Margot enter, bearing Jamba Juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, stop! You have to leave this room -- it's been a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S erena sits down on the edge of the bed, trying to psych Elle up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the thing that always makes us feel better, no matter what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cunnilingus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 Elle lets out a wail, realizing what she'll be missing. Serena shoots Margot a stern look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- the thing after that,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of uniformed manicurists and their classy clients. Chattering away. Therapy in full session. Serena sits in front of her regular nail technician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was awful. We all thought she'd be the first to walk down the aisle and now she's totally adrift. The nail technician shakes her head in shared girl-power- angst -- looking over at Elle, who sits in the waiting ar shell-shocked, but showered. Elle picks up the only magazine left on the table -- "Tow Country". She wrinkles her nose. An OLD LADY next to her reads "Seventeen". Elle looks at her, begrudging the acce to teen beauty tips, and flips through "Town & Countr n oisily until she freezes on-- the Engagement Section. S gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!                    . She looks at a PHOTO of a horse-faced YOUNG WOMAN standin next to a THREE-YEARS-OLDER VERSION OF WARNER. She turns the old lady next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who this is? The old lady looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Warner's older brother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Elle continues, undaunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just got engaged to this -- this very unfortunate-looking girl. (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Third year Yale Law student Putnam Bowes Huntington III and his fiance Layne Walker Vanderbilt, first year Yale Law." She turns to the old lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the type-of girl Warner wants to marry. This is what I need to become to be serious. The old lady looks at the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butt ugly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- a law student. Elle rushes out.   Serena looks after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle? (turning back to her nail technician)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll never get him back with those cuticles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle sits in front of her ADVISOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flummoxed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvard Law School?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's a top three school --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offended)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a 4.0.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but your major is Fashion Merchandising. Harvard won't be impressed that you aced "History of Lycra". What are your backups?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need backups.      Harvard is the school I' m going to. He decides to humor her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then. You'll need excellent recommendations from your professors, a heck of an admissions essay and at least a one-seventy-five on your LSATs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confident)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I once had to judge a Theta Chi Tighty- Whitey contest. Trust me-- I can handle anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle sits on the floor surrounded by piles of LSAT prep books, the framed photo of Warner, and Underdog. There's a KNOCK at the door as Serena and Margot peek ins gasping in horror at the sight of books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! Elle smiles brightly at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reading about the LSATs. Margot looks at Serena, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a horrified whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cousin had them. Apparently you get a really bad rash on your -- Elle interrupts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LSATs are an exam. She takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls-- I ' m going to Harvard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, like on va-kay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's all go! Road trip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- Cecil has a condo in Tahoe. Let's go there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I ' m going to law school at Harvard. They look at her, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I know you're upset and all, but can't you just take a sedative? Elle rolls her eyes at their naivete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once Warner sees me as a serious law student, he'll want me back. It's a completely brilliant plan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But isn't it kind of hard to get into law school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the highest GPA in Delta Gamma! Margot pulls something off her wrist and hands it to Elle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.   You're gonna need this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your scrunchie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lucky scrunchie.     It helped me pass Spanish. Serena rolls her eyes and looks at Margot disapprovingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You passed Spanish because you gave Professor Montoya a hand-job after the final.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (duh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, luckily. A MONTAGE OF THE NEXT 3 MONTHS BEGINS WITH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON VIDEO, Elle sits in a Jacuzzi in her bikini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Elle Woods and for my admissions essay, I ' d like to tell all of you at Harvard why I ' m going to make an amazing lawyer.

dialogues.text: The girls watch a horror movie with Kappa Sigs. Eating popcorn and drinking red wine. Off to the side, Elle reads an LSAT Study Guide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As president of my sorority, I ' m skilled at commanding the attention of a room and discussing important issues. Elle bangs a gavel, as she sits in front of her sisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ~        It has come to my attention that the maintenance staff is switching our toilet paper from Charmin to generic. All those opposed to chafing, pleas.e say "aye". The sisters "AYE" in unison.      Underdog barks his appr

dialogues.text: "LSAT Prep Course" is written on the board. Elle and fort other law school hopefuls take notes furiously as practic questions are reviewed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON VIDEO, FROM ABOVE, we see Elle as she floats on a raft her pool, in a pink Versace bikini. She addresses the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ' m able to recall hundreds of important details at the drop of a hat. We reveal Margot on a raft beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (badly acting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
