dialogues.text: Elle takes a practice LSAT exam as Serena, Margot and a f other Delta Gammas do their butt-crunches in the Delta Ga living room. Serena, while clenching her tush, hits a stop watch and E starts writing furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margot is now on all-fours, doing donkey kicks as she gra Elle's practice exam. She writes "143" on top and holds i up to Elle. Elle slumps with frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON VIDEO, Elle is rollerblading in shorts and a tank top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the laws and bi-laws of civil obedience are crucial to my life -- Serena skates by and fake-elbows Elle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; calling after her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shoving on the skate path! City ordinance 22G!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle sits in front of Amy, as Amy quizzes her with practi LSAT questions. Books are piled high around them. Elle gazes out the.window to see ---Warner and some BARE- CHESTED FRATERNITY BOYS carrying a keg across the quad. H eyes light up and she looks at Amy pleadingly. Amy shakes head no. Elle slumps, then rises and goes to the window, closing the shades and getting back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON VIDEO, Elle addresses the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel confident using legal jargon in daily life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON VIDEO, Elle walks across campus with Underdog in her purse, feigning staged innocence. A RANDOM FRAT BOY pinch her butt. She slaps his hand, dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I object!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "LSAT EXAM -- Sections 1-6" is scrawled on the chalk boar Elle sits in an auditorium with about 90 other students, booklet open, filling in answers. Concentrating so hard she's practically getting a forehead wrinkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON VIDEO, Elle speaks to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen every episode of "The Practice" and I ' m even on speaking terms with Dylan McDermott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan McDermott gets into his car and pulls out of his driveway. VIDEOTAPING MADLY, the girls follow in Elle's Boxster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up next to him! Elle swerves around to pull up next to Dylan McDermott. scream at him as Serena videotapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan!   We love you! Dylan McDermott burns rubber as he flees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 31 ON.VIDEO, Elle jogs while she addresses the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to camera)                                           . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm totally focused and goal-oriented. Plus I ' m able to sway people with my very convincing arguments. She turns to Serena, jogging next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin Klein's spring line is atrocious. Don't you agree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (convinced)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy rushes in with a stack of mail, waving an LSAT envelo as she calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's here! Elle rushes down the stairs as the other Delta Gammas gat around. Elle takes the envelope and says a quick prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One seventy-five...one seventy- five... She opens it and stares at it for a long moment. Then tur it to the crowd and raises it above her head in triumph. girls immediately begin jumping up and down as group joy ensues. Underdog yips with pride. The MONTAGE ENDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TV, Elle stands up in the Jacuzzi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's why you should vote for me. Elle Woods. Future lawyer. For the Class of 2003. The video is PAUSED, as three ADMISSIONS GUYS in their 4. sit at a table piled high with applications, the DEAN OF ADMISSIONS at the head of it. STUNNED SILENCE fills the r Finally one of them speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was certainly a very -- (adjusting himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imaginative essay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Dean)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does have a 4.0 from USC and she got a one-seventy-nine on her LSATs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fashion major?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we've never had one before... aren't we always looking for diversity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her list of extracurriculars is impressive. The Dean looks at her application.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unimpressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was in a Ricky Martin video --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly, she's interested in music...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading on; skeptical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She also designed a line of faux fur panties for her sorority's charity project --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she's a friend to animals as well as a philanthropist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's obvious that she's a very well-rounded individual. He points to Elle -- freeze-framed in her bikini-top on video, on the TV. The admissions guys look to the Dean. folds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle Woods -- Welcome to Harvard. 34   EXT. WOODS' BACKYARD - DAY                         . Elle's parents -- DANIEL, in tennis clothes, and the face lifted SAPPHIRE -- stare at Elle over juice by the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Law school? Sapphire puts a hand to her throat in distress.    Elle i confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a perfectly respectable place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart, you don't need law school. Law school is for people who are boring and ugly and Serious. And you, button/ are none of those things. Sapphire is in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were first runner-up in the Miss Hawaiian Tropic contest. Why throw all that away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because this is what I want. I've worked hard for it. Don't you understand that this is important to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 34 She looks at her uncomprehending parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to Harvard is the only way I can get the love of my life back! Sapphire looks at her, still not getting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you just suck his wiener?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you just get your nose done? Elle reacts to her mother's skewed logic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pale, studious LAW STUDENTS clad in earth tones, move int their dorm, carrying in their spartan belongings (coffee makers, books, computers). In the distance, a HAPPY POP SONG (perhaps "Heaven Tonigh Hole) is heard. As it gets louder, heads turn to see -- A silver, convertible Boxster driving up, Elle at the whe MUSIC BLASTING. A large MOVING VAN follows the Boxster. Peop le lean out of their windows, buzzing with interest Elle's car stops in front of the dorm. She hops out, scooping up Underdog and looking every inch the LA-Fred-S glamour-queen, as she looks around with a smile. Elle looks at Underdog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here! She bends down to pour some Evian into his inflatable dog dish, inadvertently revealing cleavage to a passing BESPECTACLED BOY (several yards away). He trips, dropping his I-MAC. It shatters into a million pieces. Not noticing/ Elle stands and turns to two MOVING GUYS/ w are hauling a pink, faux-fur love seat and a potted palm out of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, guys! With a beauty queen smile in place, she strides into the as the other students watch in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: HANGING OUT OF THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: ARROGANT AARON, a Mensa geek with attitude, turns to his roommate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose knob did she honk to get in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: " W e l c o m e Law Students Class of 2003" banners hang o r i e n t a t i o n tables manned by second year law st w e a r i n g red t-shirts. Club tables with banners that " H a r v a r d Law Journal" and "Environmental Law Assoc s e t up nearby. E l l e takes a packet from a fuzzy MALE 2L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Class schedule, map, book list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H a s Warner Huntington checked in yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ( ch ec ki ng)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: U h , no. Maybe you should try the Lido dec k. S h e frowns and starts to move on, but then looks throug p a c k e t with a frown and turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W a i t -- my social events schedule is             . mis sin g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y o u r what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know -- mixers, formals, beach В·         trips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a pizza welcome lunch in twenty minutes. Does that count?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wrinkling her nose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it'll have t o . . . The Fuzzy Guy looks at the red-shirted BALD 2L next to hi as Elle walks off. ,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell.was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching her go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malibu Barbie lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle sits at the outdoor table, ignoring her slice of piz as she looks around for Warner. Not finding him, she turn her attention to the Group Leader, a BURNED OUT 2L in a r shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Welcome to law school. This is the part where we go around in a circle and everyone says a little bit about themselves. Let's start with you. He gestures at a guy with glasses, DORKY DAVID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a Masters in Russian Literature, a Ph.D in Biochemistry, and for the last eighteen months, I've been de- worming orphans in Somalia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome.   How about you, Enid? ENID, a militant feminista, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P h.D from Berkeley in Women's Studies-- emphasis in the History of Combat. And last year, I led the march for Lesbians Against Drunk Driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37 He looks at an intense guy in his late twenties, IVAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got an MBA from Wharton, worked on Wall Street for four years, mushed in three ididarods and I ' ve figured out how to crash the stock market in Sri Lanka if any of you want to get together later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet.    What about you? He looks at Elle.   She sits up straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ' m a Gemini. I have a Bachelors degree from USC, where I was Sigma Chi Sweetheart and president of Delta Gamma, and last year 'В· -- I was Homecoming Queen . She smiles, as the group leader nods, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! (dramatically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two weeks ago, I saw Cameron Diaz at Fred Segal -- and talked her out of buying a truly heinous angora sweater! Whoever said that orange is the new pink is seriously disturbed. She looks around, pleased. Enid' snickers as the rest of group stares at Elle, dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grey, dingy, cell-block style room -- now crammed with Elle's clothes, the pink fluffy love seat and potted palm along with an Elliptical Cross-Trainer, pink flamingo par lights and a neon pink margarita glass sculpture. Elle tries to shove a large law textbook into her tiny Pr backpack to no avail. She gives up and tosses the book on the bed where Underdog leaps away to miss being squished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish me luck, Underdog. It's my first class as a serious law student. She kisses him and looks down at her completely inappropr skimpy Gucci outfit, which she accents by putting on tren wire-rimmed glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I totally look the part!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle heads for a classroom, amidst a crowd of students wh eye her like she's an alien. She rounds a corner, seeing WARNER, in all his handsome glory, looking over his sched She starts toward him, as if pulled by a magnetic force. Arrogant Aaron sees her passing by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seductively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H l o t e e. . . . . . . el hr. Elle keeps going, not even noticing him. Eyes only for Warner. Arrogant Aaron stomps away, pissed at the perceiv blow-off. As Elle gets closer to Warner, she opts for wandering pas him, seemingly oblivious to his presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle?! Elle turns, ultra-nonchalant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warner?! Oh my God, I completely forgot you were going here! He looks at her, confused.    People walk by, staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? You're not here to see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, silly.    I go here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvard. Law school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: v- y --                   Y ou g o t in to Ha rv a rd L aw ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (con fuse d at his confusion) W h at , like it's that.hard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W a rn e r stares at her :-- completely discombobulated. s m i l es sweetly and makes a show of checking her watch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Oops! Time for class. Meet me after? On the benches?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh -- sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sashays off with a confident smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students file in and take their seats. Elle enters, looki around nervously at the imposing auditorium. Arrogant Aar next to her, leans over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're looking for the best seat, I hear the front row is the place to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROFESSOR ELSPETH STROMWELL, a tough-as-nails Grande Dame her 50' s , addresses the class. Laptops abound -- except Elle, who has a fuzzy pink notebook and a pen with a pink plastic heart on the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A legal education means you will learn to speak in a new language. You will be taught to achieve insight into the world around you, and to sharply question what you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone soaks this up.        Including Elle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seat you've picked is yours for the next nine months of your life. Enjoy it. And those of you in the front row, beware.      .    .. El le , in the front row, between two UNSHOWERED BRANIACS looks around, panicked. One of the braniacs passes her th seating chart and she has no choice but to sign her name. In the back, Arrogant Aaron nudges his friend and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The law is reason free from passion." Does anyone know who spoke those immortal words? Dorky David raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aristotle. Professor Stromwell approaches him the way Cruella de Vil approaches a puppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Now he's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ~        Would you be willing to stake your life on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H o w about -- She spins around, roughly POKING another student in the h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- his life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I recommend knowing before speaking.. The law leaves much room for interpretation -- but very little for self-doubt. As she turns away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you were right. It was Aristotle. The class half-laughs in relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assume you've all read pages 1- 48 and are now well-versed in subject matter jurisdiction. Elle looks around, surprised, as students open their book

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who can tell us about Gordon v. Steele? Silence.   Stromwell looks down at the seating chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivan Greenstein? Intense Ivan straightens in his' seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon sued her doctors for malpractice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what did the dispute entail? (looking at her chart)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's call on someone in the hot zone. Elle Woods? Elle looks up, distressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... I wasn't aware that we had an assignment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at her chart)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah Knottingham? SARAH KNOTTINGHAM -- a prim and preppy blue-blood brunett dressed in pearls and a sweater set -- looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it's acceptable that Ms. Woods is unprepared? Sarah looks over at Elle. Elle gives her a mortified smil Sarah turns back to Professor Stromwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you support my decision to ask her to leave and return to class only when she is prepared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Elle can't believe that this girl would betray her. Havin no choice,, she gathers her purse and goes, completely humiliated. Professor Stromwell returns to the matter at hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Ms. Knottingham, did diversity jurisdiction'exist in this case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMMETT -- a shy and quirkily handsome 28-year-old who cou pass for younger -- sits on a bench, going over some pape He looks up and spots Elle -- sitting across from him -- looking traumatized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Elle looks up, snapping out of her stupor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they just -- put you on the spot like that? Like, all the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The professors? Yeah, they tend- to do that. Socratic method.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you don't know the answer, they just kick you out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have Stromwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeful) Did she do that to you, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but she made me cry once. Not in class -- I waited until I got to my room, but yeah, she can pretty much shrivel your balls -- or you know, your whatevers .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stricken) Neat .             В·    '   ,   '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. It gets better. Who else do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle looks at her schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donovan, Royalton and Levinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak up in Donovan's class. He likes people with an opinion. Sit in the back for Royalton. He tends to spit when he talks about products liability.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle makes a face.      He smiles.   Liking her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And make sure you read the footnotes in Levinson's class. That's where all her exam questions come from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   I ' m glad I met you. She smiles at him, grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and getting one of Stromwell's daily quotes right is almost as important as acing the mid-term. But you didn't hear it from me. Students trickle out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a third-year? Warner walks up, behind Emmett, interrupting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Elle looks up, pure adoration on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! Emmett rises and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again for your help! Warner remains standing, still somewhat uncomfortable wit her presence here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S o -- uh -- how was your first class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Except for this horrible girl who made me look bad in front of my Civ Pro professor. But no biggie. You're here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your summer? She pats the bench beside her.     He doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do anything exciting? A female hand snakes around Warner's chest from behind. Warner turns and brings the owner of the hand around to h side, presenting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urn, hey, have you met Sarah? Sarah, the horrible girl herself, holds out her hand to E full of contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.     Sarah Knottingham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Warner; horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В·      You know her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She 's -- Sarah jumps in.                            В·

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I ' m his fiancee. Elle stares at her. Sarah tucks a piece of her mousy brow hair behind her ear and there it is -- The Rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in disbelief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I just hallucinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah was my girlfriend at prep school. We got back together over the summer at my grandmother's birthday party. Elle looks stricken.     Sarah gives her a smug smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warner told me all about you. You're famous at our Club. She says it in a way that is anything but flattering.   I fact, it's completely condescending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; pointedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he didn't tell me you'd be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know -- Elle looks from Warner to Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. She rushes off.    Sarah watches her go, a smug grin on h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: face, В·

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Warner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said she was pretty.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET/INT. ELLE'S CONVERTIBLE BOXSTER- DAY
dialogues.text: Elle drives, wiping the tears from her face. She spots something off to the side and SWERVES her car toward it, gasp of hope escaping her lips. Her car stops in front of a strip mall salon called "Beau Oasis".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A downscale, blue-collar salon, with five hair chairs and manicure stations. Old ladies and young waitresses get pe PAULETTE --early 40s, lower-middle class, hard-edged, plu sirzed -- looks up as a defeated Elle sinks into the mani chair.(The manicure station is plastered with pictures of RUFUS, a big, slobbering pit-bull). В·

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad day? Elle holds out her hands. Paulette dips them into a dish soapy water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't even imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Spill., Elle lets it all out in a rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked really hard to get into law school -- I blew off Spring Break and Greek Week to study for the LSATs, I completely neglected my Homecoming Queen duties, I hired a Coppola to direct my admissions video -- all so I could get my boyfriend Warner back and now he's engaged to this awful girl Sarah so it was all for nothing! I wish I ' d never even come to Harvard. Paulette dries Elle's hands and begins filing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you went to all that trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what am I supposed to do? He's engaged! She's got the family six-carat on her bony, unpolished finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're asking the wrong girl. I ' m with my guy eight years and then one day it's "I met someone else. Move out."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cried a lot and gained twenty pounds. Dewey kept the trailer and my precious baby Rufus. I got jackcrap. She looks at a picture of the pit-bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; re the dog)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't even get to go to his birthday party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could I do?                                          (shrugging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a man who followed his pecker to                     greener pastures. I ' m a middle-aged high-               school dropout with stretch marks and a                   fat ass. Happens every day. At least to                   women like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's terrible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's this Sarah got that you don't? Three tits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's from Connecticut. She belongs to his stupid country club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she as pretty as you? Elle looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ' m not pretty -- I ' m genetically blessed. Paulette rolls her eyes, shaking her bottle of polish and starting on Elle's right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is sJie.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could use some mascara and some serious highlights, but she's not completely unfortunate- looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, ladies.                                            Paulette looks up to see the UPS GUY, a strapping hunk of man in his late 30' s . She blushes and smooths down her knocking over a bottle of nail polish in the process. Try to play it off as she signs for the package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya later. He goes. Paulette watches him. Elle notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hating herself)                               .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I be anymore goddamn spastic? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're sure, this Warner guy is "the one"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely! I love him! Paulette looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If a girl like you can't hold on to her man -- then there sure as hell isn't any hope for the rest of us. What're you waiting for? Steal the bastard back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle knocks on Warner's door, bottle of wine and two glas in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warner? When she gets no answer, she write a message on his memo board -- CLOSE ON-- "Call me! Love, You Know Who". She leaves the wine bottle and two glasses and goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle is in her push-up bikini, reclining in her beach cha pink frozen margarita in one hand, Underdog in the other, book in her lap, pretending to study. We PULL BACK to reveal that she's sitting on the sideline a touch-football game that Warner is playing with a group other 1-L's. Warner scores easily because the other male eyes are all Elle. He shakes his head and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle sits, glaring at Sarah, who keeps waving her "The Ro in Elle's direction, as she plays footsie with Warner. PROFESSOR DONOVAN -- 40s, a big fan of himself, salt and pepper hair, no time for bullshit -- stands before the cl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should warn you that in addition to competing against each other for the top grade in this class, you'll also be competing for one of my firm's highly coveted four internship spots next year where you will get to assist on actual cases. Let the bloodbath begin. Now, let's commence with our usual torture -- He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms . Woods -- Sarah and her bitchy, clone-like friend CLAIRE exchange knowing glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This should be amusing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you rather have a client who committed a crime malum in se or malum prohibitum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather have a client who's innocent. Elle smiles, proud of her answer. The class snickers. War frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .        Dare to dream, Ms. Woods. Ms. Knottingham? Which would you prefer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malum prohibitum. Because the client would've committed a regulatory infraction as opposed to a dangerous crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?   Ms. Woods?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed my mind. I ' d pick the dangerous one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks pointedly at Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I ' m not afraid of a challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah glares back at her. Warner looks between the two of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: them, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Harvard Public Interest Law Association meeting is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O        underway. Warner .listens intently, A few seats appears to be taking notes. C L O SE ON--her "notes" -- "I'm free for dinner tonight. me at The Cask & Flagon at 8." She folds the note and sticks it in Underdog's mouth, the him toward Warner. Humiliated but dutiful, Underdog bound CLOSE ON -- Underdog, as he carries forth his mission, arriv ing at Warner's feet. UNDERDOG'S POV -- Warner discreetly takes the note from him, then looks over at El who feigns interest in the meeting. 49   INT. CASK & FLAGON RESTAURANT - NIGHT Elle waits for Warner, alone at a table. Checking her wat to see it's 8:45, she tries not to be sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warner and his study group, Sarah and Claire included, si a table, going over their outlines. Elle walks up to the table, holding a basket of muffins, bright smile on her f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '        I ' m here to join your study group. And look! I brought sustenance! She holds up the muffins as the others look up, frowns al around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously looking at Sarah)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle, what're you doing here? Elle pulls up a chair from another table and holds up a muffin.                       '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's first? She sits down next to Warner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our group is full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, was this like an RSVP thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's like a smart people thing.     And like Sarah said, we're full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on ~ we can make room for one more. Sarah looks at Warner with evil eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've already assigned the outlines, and everyone has started theirs',

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Warner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, you wouldn't let the fat guy _    join.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to watch me take'a shower! Sarah looks at Elle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer is no. Warner looks at her, feeling guilty. He shrugs an "I'm sorry", but Elle's perkiness has gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gathers up her muffins and stands, clutching the bask to her chest as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess I'll leave you alone. She walks away, completely deflated, passing by the RAGIN FEMINIST STUDY GROUP. Enid calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there's a sorority you could join instead. Elle stops and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Enid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if you'd come to a Rush party, I would've at least been nice to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before you voted against me and called me a dyke behind my back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't use that word. Only mean people use that word. You must've heard it from Sarah.                     . She looks back at Warner's table and walks off. As she do she's nearly mowed down by a gaggle of NERDS led by DORKY DAVID, who knock the muffins out of her hands. She stands there, even more depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle sinks down onto her bed, deflated.    She picks up t phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serena, with a new hairdo, and Margot are surrounded by wedding dresses. Margot talks on her cell phone. We INTERCUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Serena)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Elle! (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess what I ' m doing right this second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power yoga?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picking out my wedding dress!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В· What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh proposed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) N o way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serena grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) ;;po you have The Rock yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hurry up so you can come home!   We miss you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you guys! The people here are so vile! Hardly anyone even talks to me unless it's to say something that's not nice. Law school sucks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!   I completely forgot to tell you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got bangs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt and annoyed) Re a ll y --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margot grabs the phone back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep June first open -- you're one of my bridesmaids. And give Warner our love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iwl. il.   .    .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margot hangs up and Elle follows suit.      Even more def

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Claire walk past Elle's room, the door of which ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just any Halloween party. It's a "Come as Your Favorite Defendant" party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That-'s genius. Elle pops her head out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way! Someone at this school is actually having a party? Sarah and Claire turn around.      Elle's face falls when sees that it's them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must've heard us wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Looks like you'll be staying home ton ig ht. Alone. They continue on as Elle goes back into her room, snubbed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle shuts the door behind her and looks at Underdog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this. Not only do I not have Warner, but I ' m --unpopular! The realization hits her hard. Underdog barks.       She

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I wasn't invited. He barks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think I should?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two feet in high heels and fishnet hose stride purposeful up the sidewalk.                                    . A perfect butt wearing a bunny tail wiggles up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A party filled with people who are no fun to party with. NAMETAGS denote which famous defendant everyone is dresse Menenedez's, Tonya Harding's, and Buttafuco's pepper the Elle, decked out in a Playboy Bunny costume -- looking se as hell -- strides in. People roll their eyes and ignore her. Elle continues on. NEARBY -- Enid, dressed as Lizzie Borden, axe in hand/ is the midst of a tirade against some guy dressed like Willi Kennedy Smith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The English language is all about subliminal domination. Take the word "semester". It's a perfect example of this school's discriminatory preference of semen to ovaries. That's why I ' m petitioning to have next term be referred to as Winter Ovester. The guy backs up in fright. As Elle passes, Enid looks ov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey , Elle-- I've been meaning to ask you (re her boobs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- are those real? Elle snorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enid, please -- silicone is so 90's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56 She keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sa rah -- dressed as Hester Prynne -- and Claire --as Joa Arc -- sip wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for inviting me, girls. This party is super fun. They roll their eyes, checking out her Bunny costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to be dressed as a famous defendant. Elle smiles at Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. Didn't you hear about the Playboy Bunny who slit her ex- boyfriend's new fiancee's throat with a broken wine glass? It was tragic. She grabs a glass of wine and moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle walks onto the back porch and finds Warner --dressed O.J. in a USC football uniform, number 32, with a ball an chain on his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, O.J. Warner turns. He looks around for Sarah.      Not seeing smiles at Elle, admiring her costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.    You're a walking felony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.     Having fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ( c h e c k i n g her out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flirty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like we've barely spent any time together since we got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because I spend all my time with case studies and hypos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. I can't imagine doing all this and Donovan's internship next year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scoffing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle, c'mon, there's no way you'll get the grades to qualify for one of those spots . You're not smart enough. She can't believe he's saying this.   He realizes he's go too far, and back-pedals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I on glue, or did I not get into the same law school you did, Warner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ll , yeah, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what? We took the same LSAT, we take th e same classes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't want to see you get your hopes up. You know how you get. She stares at him.   Realizing the awful truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'11 never be good enough for you, will

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: When he doesn't answer, she walks back into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of tipsy ILs stand around. bowl filled with cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give her two more weeks. She throws a twenty into the bowl.      '    В·.   .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two and a half? He throws in his twenty as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she spreads her legs, maybe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adjusting his crotch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if I ' m feeling generous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? They turn around to find Elle standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're betting on how much longer you're going to last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stung)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look around, Elle.      Do you actually think you belong here? They all stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wouldn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the rest of us provide some worthwhile value to society?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, now -- every society needs a bimbo. Who are we supposed to sleep with after we get rich?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 Elle looks like she's been slapped. The others laugh at Aaron's esteemed wit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? All of you can just kiss my ass. She yanks off her Bunny tail and throws it at them. Hurt anger in her eyes. Then walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: ' ELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing; to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're about to see just how valuable Elle Woods can be. She stomps out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hot pink laptop is yanked off the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle, still in her Bunny suit, minus the tail, stands in line, paying for the laptop. People gape at her, but she' oblivious in her resolve. EMMETT walks up behind her in line.   He clears his throa trying not to look at her costume. Elle turns, seeing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't gonna.                                - She marches off.   Laptop in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pony-tailed Elle types a brief, coffee next to her. Underdog sleeps nearby, belly-up. Legs twitching in a nightmare. Typing furiously, Elle breaks a nail, then struggles to forge on, despite her instinct to stop and repair it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle -- arms full of books -- walks past the Warner/Sarah study group. Sarah and Claire scowl at her, but Elle pass with her head held high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enid is surrounded by study materials and notecards. When she gets up to use the ladies' room, Elle casually walks and slips a notecard into the middle of Enid's stack. The quickly walks on. '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pau lett e quizzes Elle from a law textbook as her nails As she waits for Elle's answer, Paulette showers Underdog with kisses, showing him pictures of Rufus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donovan is in the midst of a lecture.     He points at El

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the purpose of "diminished capacity" is? She swallows nervously, then speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To negate mens rea? Donovan nods affirmatively and continues.      Elle hides smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle reaches for a book on a high shelf, but she's not ta enough. She tries a running start and leaps for it. Still missing it. FROM THE LEFT, she runs and leaps again, missing again. FROM THE RIGHT, she runs and leaps again, missing again. Dorky David walks up and sets down a step-stool at her: f Now winded, she smiles her thanks, stepping up to retriev her book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enid flips through her notecards, memorizing, when she co upon a picture of a NAKED MAN. Oh, the horror. She throws down in disgust as if her eyes have been burned. Looking around, Enid sees Elle smiling and waving at her across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle walks past Arrogant Aaron, as he sleeps at his study cubicle, head back on the chair. She stops, backs up, and waves her hand over his face. Wh he doesn't stir, she takes a magic marker out of her knap and leans over to write something on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 Elle works out on her Elliptical Crosstrainer as she list to a lecture tape and watches Court TV on mute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "A failure to act can constitute the actus reus for accomplice liability if the defendant has the legal duty intervene, but fails to do so."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrogant Aaron wakes up with a start, checks his watch, a rushes off to class. Oblivious to his facial graffiti, wh we can't yet read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Stromwell is in front of the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've filed a claim. Now what? She looks over to see Elle sitting there, typing on her laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Woods?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you also need to have evidence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning? Everyone now stares at Elle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning you need -- reasonable belief that your claim would have, like, evidentiary support? Stromwell is somewhat impressed, but doesn't show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what kind of evidentiary support does this case require? Let's ask Mr. Harriman, who clearly believes that I might be hungry. She looks up at Arrogant Aaron in the back row. Who unknowingly has "Eat Me" written on his forehead. He look back at her, confused, as the students around him snicker

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "Closed" sign is on the door. THROUGH THE WINDOW, we see Elle and Paulette sitting in t empty salon, laughing and clinking cans of Pabst Blue Rib as they toast Elle's small victory. We PULL BACK, leaving them laughing, as the MONTAGE ENDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "THE STATE V. LATIMER" is written on the board. A pony- tailed, less made-up Elle takes notes on her lap-top, as Warner makes an argument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . According to Swinney v. Neubert, Swinney, who was also a private sperm donor, was allowed visitation rights as long as he came to terms with the hours set forth by the parents. So, if we're sticking to past precedent, Mr. Latimer wasn't st al ki ng -- he was clearly within his rights to ask for visitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Swinney was a one-time sperm donor, and in our case, the defendant was a habitual sperm donor, who also happens to be harassing the parents in his quest for visitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But , without this man's sperm --the child in question would not exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins and looks around as the class murmurs their agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're thinking like a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMMETT enters from the back, holding a file.        He st quietly, watching. В· Elle tentatively raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Woods? Sarah looks at Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The idiot speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although Mr. Huntington makes an excellent point, I have to wonder if the defendant kept a thorough record of each sperm emission made throughout his life? The class titters.    Elle grows annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bemused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you ask? Elle's hesitancy is replaced by conviction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, unless the defendant attempted to contact every single one-night- stand to determine if a child resulted in those unions -- then he has no parental claim whatsoever over this child. Why this s p e rm ? Why now?      ' Emmett's mouth twitches into a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) For that matter, all masturbatory emissions where his sperm was clearly not seeking an egg could be termed reckless abandonment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warner's mouth hangs open. As does Sarah's and the rest o the class. Donovan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you've just won your case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: It's so shameful...

dialogues.text: Whatever it is -- it could save you.

dialogues.text: How? Brooke composes herself. Takes a deep breath. Looks at El

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have made my fortune on my ability to teach women how to perfect their bodies with the Brooke's Butt Buster workout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!   You helped me go from a six to a four! Brooke starts to cry again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (completely shamed)

dialogues.text: I ' m a fraud! But it's not like normal people can have this ass! If my fans knew, I ' d lose everything. I've already lost my husband. I rather be in jail then lose my reputation! Elle hugs her to her chest, consoling her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your secret is safe with me. 95   INT. AUSTEN, PLATT, JARET & DONOVAN - LIBRARY - The associates and interns sit at a table piled high with research, as Donovan goes over his notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..              We've got two interviews tomorrow that Dick and Bobby are gonna handle, and the ex-wife in an hour. He looks up.

dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.text: I promised her I ' d keep it secret. I can't break the bonds of sisterhood! Now he's pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Donovan? Mrs. Windham Vandermark is on line two. Donovan rises, still annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: , No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we're not very good lawyers. Emmett hides a smile.     Warner leans over to Elle.   Sa nearby, listening. В·

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.text: If you tell him, you'll probably make summer associate. Who cares.about Brooke? Think about yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And subscribe to the doctrine of self- hatred imposed upon my gender by male delusions of the way women are supposed to look? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice. Donovan motions toward Elle. Then looks at Emmett with a pointed "Get the alibi" look.

dialogues.text: Go with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett drives, Elle is shotgun.

dialogues.text: Explain to me why you're so anti- Brooke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, for starters, she won'-t give us an al i bi --

dialogues.text: Aside from that.

dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.text: She married an old man, she's made a living on telling women they're too fat, she hawks her crap on the Home Shopping Network...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A) He's an old man with a really big penis. B) She never told me I was fat. And C) Victoria Principal sells on that network.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And D) Brooke is obviously hiding something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But maybe it's not what you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bu t maybe it is--         . They're quiet for a moment.     She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kind of being a butt-head right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because people aren't always what they seem to be and you refuse to see that. Have a little faith. You might be surprised. They're quiet again while he thinks about this.         H over at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you called me a butt- head. No one's called me a butt-head since ninth grade.

dialogues.text: Maybe not to your face... She gives him a teasing smile.        He smiles back at h shaking his head.

dialogues.text: Elle and Emmett are at the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Oh, and my friend Katherine Windham Vandermark is here somewhere and I ' m supposed to meet her. for a Pilates class. Do you have her schedule?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking)

dialogues.text: She's in the mud room until four. Elle smiles her thanks and walks off with Emmett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. WINDHAM VANDERMARK, late 40s, brunette, East Coast h t o i t y -- lies on a table like a corpse, stiff with mu cucumbers over her eyes. Elle and Emmett poke their heads

dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.text: (to Emmett)

dialogues.text: I'll cover her -- parts. Elle settles on three washcloths, strategically placed.

dialogues.text: So, I hear the tart from California shot    - Heyworth.

dialogues.text: Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ys. . . . e

dialogues.text: Like I said, I've never met Brooke, but I have seen her from a distance. When I ' d come over to pick up the alimony check that Heyworth forgot to mail every month, she'd be out by the pool, with Mr. Hot Pants hovering over her with some pink drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hovering?

dialogues.text: Emmett drives, raving.

dialogues.text: You're going to trust the word of a woman who named her child after a condiment? She's ly-ing.

dialogues.text: Did you see the icky black color of her hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never trust a woman who's not blonde. Except for my friend Serena, but that's only because she's a blonde at heart. That's the whole reason I ' m starting the Blonde Legal Defense Fund. He looks at her and laughs.

dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.text: Blondes are discriminated against worldwide! Brooke's a blonde, and people are saying she's sleeping with the cheesy pool boy and shooting her husband. If she was a mousy brunette, it would be, "Oh, the poor widow."

dialogues.text: You're serious? She's fired up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, how would it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be a full-service law firm, by and for blondes, providing positive blonde role models and community outreach in high blonde areas. I mean, think about it -- name one blonde intellectual role model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is a direct result of anti- blonde discrimination!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- Hilary Clinton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she were a true blonde, she would've left the cheating bastard. Blondes don't let their husbands get fellated by brunettes and live to tell about it. Emmett frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .     In that case, maybe Heyworth got --- fellated --by a brunette and Brooke caught him.

dialogues.text: Exactly how much gorilla sex do you think a sixty-year-old man can take? В·.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bags under your eyes. You're an attractive man, but you need to take better care of yourself.

dialogues.text: I don't -- (gesturing to the cream)

dialogues.text: Do that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .         (sighing) Fine. Sorry I brought it up. She puts the cream back in her purse.        They ride in fo r a moment. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

Elle stops at this and sighs, acknowledging to herself that she has to help this guy. turns and marches back, SLAPPING Dorky David across the Dorky David is stunned, as is the Freshman Girl.

dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.text: y                   Have you ever noticed that Donovan ne asks Warner to bring him coffee? He's asked me at least a dozen times.

dialogues.text: Did you know he got wait-listed when he appli ed? His father had to make a call.

dialogues.text: Surprise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: T ha t ' s okay --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you guys are actually here -- but this case is important. I'll make it up to you after finals, okay? I --      promise. I really want to do a good job. Margot and Serena stare at her, realizing she means it.

dialogues.text: Okay. . . Call us if you change your mind. They start to head out. Margot hands Sa-rah the bottle of

dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: I'll call you as soon as it's over, okay? Sisters forever?

dialogues.text: Sister forever. She shuts the door behind them.    Then looks at Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.text: You broke his nose?! We INTERCUT with Paulette as she watches- UPS Guy being carried out by paramedics on a gurney. The ladies of the shop flutter around him, concerned.

dialogues.text: Don't stomp your little Prada sandals at me, Miss Thing. He walks past, as.Elle gapes at him.     Realizing.
