dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gay -- he isn't Brooke's lover! He's making it up. Whoever killed Heyworth is paying him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back up.     How do you know he's gay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gay men know designers.     Straight men don't. She points at Warner, who shrugs. Brooke leans over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enrique's gay. I ' m sure of it.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did leave a Cher tape in the pool house once -- Donovan scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I appreciate your masterful legal theory, I have a murder trial to attend to. He grabs Emmett's arm and pulls him aside as they confer more serious matters. Emmett looks at her as if to say "Sorry", before he looks back at Donovan. Brooke looks at Donovan, then back at Elle, rolling her e Elle sits down, pissed. Warner is next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the backup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was I supposed to know what kind of shoes you had on? She looks at him like he's a complete idiot, as the judge takes his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donovan is in front of Enrique, who is at the stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Salvatore, do you have any proof that you and Mrs. Windham were having an affair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the love in my heart. Women in the audience openly sigh.     Elle makes a puke gesture. Enid concurs. Donovan smiles a smug smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's all the proof that he has, your Honor, I think I'm done here. Emmett stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a couple of questions, Your Honor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110 Donovan glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; sotto to Donovan) Give me two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches Enrique and starts firing questions at rapi speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Did you ever take Mrs. Windham on a date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A restaurant in Oakland.      Where no one would recognize us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how long have you been sleeping with Mrs. Windham?

dialogues.speaker: . ENRIQUE
dialogues.text: Three months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is your boyfriend's name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck. The audience lets out a gasp.      Elle looks up, shocked delighted. Enrique begins to sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I ' m sorry, I misunderstood.   Chuck is just a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK, scrawny and angry, stands up in the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I ' m just your friend, why have we been doing the slippy-slap every night for the past six months?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The courtroom ERUPTS and the judge bangs the gavel. Elle smiles victoriously from her seat.   Emmett grins ba her. Donovan shakes his head, smiling in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle and Emmett walk down the stairs together in high spirits. Donovan catches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work today, Ms. Woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! He walks on.   She looks at Emmett, excited.   He high-fi her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulette is closing up as Elle follows her around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a giddy, rush)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And after they set his nose, he came back for his truck and I offered to drive for him since he was still on pain-killers and we spent the whole afternoon together! He was unconscious for part of it, but it was really fun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugging Paulette)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ' m so happy for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go at the trial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Donovan actually said the words "Good work, Ms. Woods". He takes me seriously! Can you believe it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I can believe it. You're going to make a great lawyer. Paulette looks at Elle. Emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle, you've changed my life. You are the kindest, most wonderful angel. Without you, I wouldn't have Rufus or a dinner date. Now go and share your goodness with the world while I stay here and have my hoo-hoo waxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle passes Sarah, who carries a stack of depos into the conference room to Dick and Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donovan asked to see you before you                  В· leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's already got his coffee -- maybe he needs a donut. They share a smile as Elle walks over to Donovan's glass- walled office and knocks on the door. Nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in. He beckons her inside, and she goes, shutting the door be her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's behind his desk. He motions for her to sit in one of the two chairs opposite him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You followed your intuition today and you .       were right on target. I should"ve listened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ab ou t the alibi --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ' m sorry, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) I ' m impressed that you took the initiative to go there and get it. That's what makes a good lawyer. And on top of that, you gained the client's trust and kept it.. That' s what makes a great lawyer. You're smart, Elle. Smarter than             В·В· most of the guys I have on my payroll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle is overwhelmed by his praise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That means so much to me to hear you say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donovan walks around his desk and sits in the chair oppos her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time discuss your career path. Have you thought about where you might be a summer associate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still overwhelmed) Not really. I know how competitive it       .   В·. a l l is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what competition is really about, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eager for his knowledge, Elle is on the edge of her seat. leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's about ferocity. Carnage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balancing human intelligence with animal diligence. Knowing exactly what you want and how far you'll go to get it. How far will Elle go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he says the last sentence, he SLIDES his hand UP HER THIGH.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE DONOVAN'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Sarah walks down the hallway, glancing in Donovan's offic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donovan's hand sliding up Elle's skirt.         She shake in disgust, & heads off- NOT SEEING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle stares at Donovan in horror, then grabs his hand -- stopping its journey upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset) You're hitting on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a beautiful girl, Elle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So everything you just said --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ' m a man who knows what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle rises, stung.       She stares at him for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I ' m a law student who's finally realized her professor is a pathetic asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Too bad. I thought you were a law student who wanted to be a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle is in the elevator. Flushed and upset. As the doors start to close, Sarah sticks her arm in, blocking them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You almost had me fooled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should sleep with the judge too. Then we can win the case. Sarah steps back, letting the doors shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle stomps out of the elevator, as Emmett gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He y --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm quitting. She marches past.   He follows, catching up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa -- Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Law school was a mistake.   Getting this internship was a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? You earned it- She snorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't earn anything. I got this internship because Donovan liked the way I looked. Which he made clear .tonight when he tried to feel me up. Emmett looks pissed as he processes this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mind reeling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now you're --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going back to LA. Maybe I can fulfill my destiny as a useless bimbo and join the Swedish Bikini Team. No more navy blue suits. No more panty-hose. No more trying to be something I ' m not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you're trying to be something you are? The hell with Donovan. Stay. She stops, giving him a sad smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for not treating me the way everyone else here does. Call me if you're ever in California. She walks out.   Emmett watches her go, hating it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle's Boxster, packed with suitcases and the potted palm pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle sits in front of Paulette, dejected.   Not even both with a manicure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point of staying? All people see when they look at me is blonde hair and big boobs. No one's ever going to take me seriously. The people at law s chool don't, Warner doesn't -- I don't even think my parents take me seriously. They wanted me to grow up and become a Victoria's Secret model who marries a rock star. Now, for the first time, it seemed like someone expected me to do something better with my life than wear underwear for a living. But I was kidding mys elf -- Donovan didn't see me as a lawyer. He saw me as a piece of ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like everyone else. It turns out, I am a j oke. She stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell with law school. I just came to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: IN A NEARBY CHAIR
dialogues.text: Professor Elspeth Stromwell spins around, nails drying, facing Elle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you let one stupid prick ruin your life, you're not the girl I thought you were. Elle looks at her, shocked, as Professor Stromwell stands goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A TV -- Donovan is being interviewed is on the evening news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enrique Salvatore has been discredited as a witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you go in there knowing how you were going to discredit Mr. Salvatore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. It's a little thing I like to call strategy. He gives the reporters a smug smile.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WAITING ROOM
dialogues.text: Brooke looks away from the TV. Emmett is next to her, prepping her for the following day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he always such an ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (containing himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the top defense attorney in the state. Of course he's an ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..J                    But is he an ass that's gonna win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an ass that's gonna try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks I ' m guilty, doesn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To me it is. He doesn't trust me. Why should I trust him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett thinks for a moment. Then looks at Brooke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. Why should you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People enter. Reporters set up their cameras. Dorky David passes by in a suit and tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donovan and Emmett head into the courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep that bitch away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's our client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Brooke. Elle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blatantly pissed) Funny how a woman can turn into a bitch just by saying "no".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donovan glares at Emmett as they continue in. Behind them -- SARAH stops in her tracks, having heard al this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: /В·""""В·',        Donovan takes his seat next to Brooke. v_ J

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you so happy about? You're on trial for murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fired. I have new representation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? The door of the courtroom BANGS open and ELLE STRIDES IN, dressed in a Prada mini-dress, Underdog in her purse. She blows a bubble, lets it pop, then sets her briefcase down next to Donovan's.

dialogues.speaker: ' ELLE
dialogues.text: (to Donovan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse you. You're in my way. She nudges him aside.      Donovan looks at Brooke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a law student.       She can't defend you. Dorky David steps up, holding out a marked casebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court Rule 3:03.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Donovan)                             -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counselors, approach the bench. Elle starts to head up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Donovan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you heard me. You're fired. She's my lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counselors, now.    All of you. Elle, Donovan and Emmett head up, as does the DA.      El the judge the case book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle Woods, your honor. Rule 3:03 of the Supreme Judicial Court states that a law student may appear on behalf of a defendant in criminal proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stoked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no problem with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.   I'm not allowing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you agreed last night. In the office? When we were discussing my "career"? The implication lingers in the air, as Donovan glares at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the casebook)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ruling also states that you need a licensed attorney to supervise you. Mr. Donovan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, I won't agree to. Emmett steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ' m supervising, Your Honor. Elle smiles at him. Donovan looks from Emmett to Elle, completely derailed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then, Ms. Woods.    Proceed. Elle walks back to the table with a grin.       Warner lo

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Paulette beams, the UPS Guy in the nose brace, next to he Serena and Margot, now in attendance, STAND clapping and squealing in a completely inappropriate way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Elle! Donovan takes a seat in the audience.    As he passes by

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy prison. The judge looks at Brooke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Windham, you do realize what you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. As Donovan sits, Margot leans over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck with a Delta Gamma.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DEFENSE TABLE
dialogues.text: Sarah leans forward to Elle, who gathers her notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kick some butt. Elle looks at her, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Woods, call your first witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to recall Chutney Windham as a defense witness. The crowd murmurs.     Donovan rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chutney takes her hand off of the Bible and sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Woods, begin your questioning. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9/18/2000 Revision (Pink) 125

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, your Honor, I ' d like to point out that not only is there no proof in this case, but there's a complete lack of mens rea, which by definition tells us that there is no crime without a vicious will. The DA rolls her eyes, as do the lawyers present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am aware of the meaning of mens rea. What I am unaware of is why you're giving me a vocabulary lesson instead of questioning your witness. Flustered, Elle turns to Chutney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- Ms. Windham, when you uh arrived back at the house? Was your father there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I saw. But like I said, I went straight upstairs to take a shower.           '   ,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when you came downstairs, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Brooke standing over his body, drenched in his blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Mrs. Windham didn't have a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she'd stashed it by then. Brooke rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move to strike that from the record, your Honor. Speculation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stricken. Elle mentally kicks herself for not doing this herself. Eirimett gives her a reassuring nod. She takes a deep bre then continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear a shot fired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9/18/2000 Revision (Pink) (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I was in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So at some point in the -- twenty minutes? -- you were in the shower, your father was shot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. Elle paces a bit. Underdog watches from her purse on the table, intrigued by her line of questioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9/18/2000 Revision (Pink) 125              (3)                              .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father was shot while you were in the shower? Gerard looks at Emmett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's she going with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a little faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you didn't hear the shot, because you were in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I was washing my hair. Elle's onto something, but not sure what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Windham, can you tell us what you'd been doing earlier in the day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got up, went to Starbucks, went to the gym, got a perm, and came home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you got in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe the witness has made it clear that she was in the shower. People start to murmur.    Donovan snickers.    Sarah loo worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Your Honor. Had you ever gotten a                . perm before, Miss Windham?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The beginnings of a smile start to spread across Elle's f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many, would you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two a year since I was twelve. You do the math.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, a girl in my sorority, Tracy Marcinko, got a perm once. Even though we all told her not to ~ curls really weren't the right look for her -- (chummy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't have your bone structure. Chutney almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, thankfully, that same day, she entered the Pi Kap wet t-shirt contest where she was completely hosed down from head to toe. Donovan shakes his head at her incompetence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection.    Why is this relevant? Emmett clears his throat, worried. Elle turns around, giv him a "trust me" look. Then turns back to the judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the judge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a point. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then make it. Elle looks at Chutney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chutney, why is it that Tracy Marcinko's curls were ruined when she got hosed down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they got wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Because isn't the first cardinal rule of perm maintenance that you are forbidden to wet your hair for at least twenty-four hours after getting a perm at the risk of de-activating the ammonium thiglycolate? Chutney pales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- Elle continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And wouldn't someone who's had -- thirty perms ? -- throughout her lifetime, be well aware of this rule? Chutney doesn't answer.     She just glares at Brooke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you, in fact, were not washing your hair, as I suspect you were not, since your curls are still intact, wouldn't you have heard the gunshot? Chutney continues to glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you in fact, heard the gunshot, then Brooke Windham wouldn't have had time to hide the gun before you got downstairs. Which would mean that you would've had to have found Mrs. Windham with a gun in her hand to make your story sound plausible. Isn't that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's younger than I am. Did she tell you that? How would you feel if your father married someone younger than you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, however, had time to hide the gun, didn't you, Chutney? After you shot your father? Brooke looks at Chutney in horror, realizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to shoot him -- (to Brooke)                                               I meant to shoot you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandemonium erupts.     The gavel pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle looks at Emmet t., elated at what's just happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (even more shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my G^d.! !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters mob Elle and Brooke as they make their way out the courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle, how did you know Chutney was lying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she is brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (humble)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rules of haircare are simple and finite . Any Cosmo girl would ' ve known . The reporters laugh as they snap pictures of her and a ha Brooke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOS E ON THE TV -- the channels change: golf -- a commer - Elle in the courthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the --? Daniel, Elle 's father, watches TV as he does his morning workout on the treadmill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, stop! (proud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bile's on TV! He looks next to him, where Sapphire is upside down on a inversion machine. SAPPHIRE'S POV -- the upside-down television with Elle on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! What happened to her tan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the reporters continue to mob Brooke, Elle steps aside talk to Serena and Margot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish we could stay longer, but I have a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you're a Laker Girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!   You're like, a lawyer.

dialogues.text: (to Elle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though you knew your shit today -- you're still a product of the patriarchy and a creation of the male-dominated media. And so are your friends. She looks at Serena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although -- you're kinda hot. Call me. She walks off.   Serena looks alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugging them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. She's harmless. I'll see you guys soon! Thanks for coming! She air-kisses them as Margot leads a still shell-shocked Serena away as Emmett walks up to Elle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle looks up at the courthouse as the sun sets behind it She smiles, proud of herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were amazing today. She turns and finds Warner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. He moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It made me realize something.      I ' m an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? He turns on the charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be with you, Elle.       Forever. He pulls her close, hand around her waist, kissing her. S looks up at him, a trace of the old love in her eyes. For moment, she melts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be with you, too, Warner. After a moment, she steps back, removing his hand       f waist and wrenching it behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In court.     On opposing sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.     Imagine that.   Looks like I am. She walks down the steps. Warner watches her go,        t to see Sarah, who's witnessed the entire episode. at him, then walks past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah -- hold on. She shoves him, knocking him on his ass, then rushes to . up with Elle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: So -- can we drink that champagne when I get back from the pawnshop? She pulls off her engagement ring.

dialogues.text: Hell, yes. We've got finals to study for. In Jamaica. She smiles and heads off.    Elle smiles, processing this Em me tt approaches Elle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, forget it. Besides, I have an early class tomorrow.

dialogues.text: So Friday at eight? She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads down the stairs, stops and thinks a moment, the runs back up -- -- Grabbing Emmett in a hellacious KISS. He kisses her ba We CRANE UP as they embrace on the courthouse steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Welcome Law Students Class of 2004" banners hang over orientation tables. Nervous first year students stand in line. We PAN ACROSS a row of club tables -- passing "Harvard La Journal" and "Environmental Law Association" В·-- until w reach a table that proudly bears the banner of "Blonde Le Defense Club". Elle, in a red 2L t-shirt, stands behind the table,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: straightening some flyers. UNDERDOG is plopped down on to of the stack. Elle turns to see EMMETT next to her. 'В· '                  В·         В·      '       .:.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.text: (continuing; re the crowd) Looks like you're pretty popular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle smiles, turning back as A NERVOUS 1L GIRL steps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have to be blonde to sign up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right? Elle smiles and looks down at -- the NEWLY BLONDE SARAH. Sarah returns the smile as we PULL BACK to see a CROWD of first year girls gathered around Elle's table, rushing to sign up. Ready to be as blonde as they can be.
